metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14364 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An out-of-bounds read/write access flaw was found in the USB emulator of the QEMU in versions before 5.2.0. This issue occurs while processing USB packets from a guest when USBDevice 'setup_len' exceeds its 'data_buf[4096]' in the do_token_in, do_token_out routines. This flaw allows a guest user to crash the QEMU process, resulting in a denial of service, or the potential execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the QEMU process on the host.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Ziming Zhang, Xiao Wei, Gonglei Arei and Yanyu Zhang

criterions.comment: qemu: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
